body: Can you share your rclone.conf and just run a rclone ls -vv against the remote you have configured?  (With passwords and keys removed)

I did an ``rclone ls -vv`` for the shared with me remote, however it only lists files in "My Drive", not in "Shared with me" (bug??). I did however notice this in the output:

2019/07/16 06:34:01 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/10 (error googleapi: Error 403: User Rate Limit Exceeded. Rate of requests for user exceed configured project quota. You may consider re-evaluating expected per-user traffic to the API and adjust project quota limits accordingly. You may monitor aggregate quota usage and adjust limits in the API Console: https://console.developers.google.com/apis/api/drive.googleapis.com/quotas?project=607739441803, userRateLimitExceeded)

Here's my redacted rclone.conf
[rclone no token.zip](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/3395675/rclone.no.token.zip)

403s can mean a few things. That particular one means you should use your own API key and set that up.

https://rclone.org/drive/#making-your-own-client-id

Can you share the full command you are running with the rclone ls -vv?

Also, take note of this with the changes to team drives and shared drives.

https://gsuiteupdates.googleblog.com/2019/04/shared-drives.html

I'm also experiencing this bug
With command "rclone ls -vv remote: --drive-shared-with-me", it only shows my private folders and files and don't show team drive shared with me.

Here's the debug log and rclone conf
2019/07/18 10:50:05 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.48.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "-vv" "remote:" "--drive-shared-with-me"]

Here's rclone.conf
cat /Users/rayliu/.config/rclone/rclone.conf
[remote]
type = drive
client_id = 
client_secret = 
scope = drive
token =

> 403s can mean a few things. That particular one means you should use your own API key and set that up.

I have done that already

> Also, take note of this with the changes to team drives and shared drives.

This makes no difference the only change is renaming "Team Drives" to "Shared drives"

> Can you share the full command you are running with the rclone ls -vv?

Both `rclone remote: ls --drive-shared-with-me -vv` and `rclone remote: ls -vv` list the exact same files.
Can you post your rclone.conf without passwords and keys?

[gdrive_team_old]
type = drive
client_id = 
client_secret = 
scope = drive
token = 
team_drive = 
shared_with_me = false
server_side_across_configs = true

[gdrive_mydrive]
type = drive
client_id = 
client_secret = 
scope = drive
token = 
shared_with_me = true
server_side_across_configs = true

[gdrive_team_new]
type = drive
client_id = 
client_secret =
scope = drive
token =
team_drive = 
shared_with_me = false
server_side_across_configs = true
You don't seem to have a remote named "remote:". Can you share the rclone.conf that is being used for the command you are running?

I got a bit further as I was trying to replicate what you are doing and I think I have the same issue replicated as if I use rclone ls, it isn't working, but lsf and lsd seem fine:

```
[felix@gemini ~]$ rclone lsf GD: --drive-shared-with-me -vv
2019/07/19 09:49:37 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.48.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "lsf" "GD:" "--drive-shared-with-me" "-vv"]
2019/07/19 09:49:37 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
Test/
2019/07/19 09:49:37 DEBUG : 5 go routines active

[felix@gemini ~]$ rclone lsd GD: --drive-shared-with-me

[felix@gemini ~]$ rclone ls GD: --drive-shared-with-me -vv

```

It doesn't work with 1.48/1.47 and works in 1.46:

```
[felix@gemini 146]$ ./rclone -vv ls GD: --drive-shared-with-me
2019/07/19 09:56:16 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.46" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "ls" "GD:" "--drive-shared-with-me"]
2019/07/19 09:56:16 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"

       -1 Test/Test2.xlsx
       -1 Test/TestSheet.xlsx
2019/07/19 09:56:17 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2019/07/19 09:56:17 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.46" finishing with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "ls" "GD:" "--drive-shared-with-me"]
```

@ncw did something change with rclone ls in later versions?

> You don't seem to have a remote named "remote:". Can you share the rclone.conf that is being used for the command you are running?

Yeah I know I was just substituting the remote name as `remote:`

> but lsf and lsd seem fine

I actually noticed that too when I was testing. I should've mentioned that sorry.


Anyway, aside from the `rclone ls` command, we need to figure out why files that have been shared in a "Team/Shared drive" to the Shared with me can't be seen in rclone.
I'm going to test if it works on 1.46
`rclone ls` does work correctly with 1.46 however files shared via Team/Shared drives still aren't shown.

According to the [files list API](https://developers.google.com/drive/api/v3/reference/files/list) you need to set the `supportsTeamDrives` boolean to see files from team drives.

Rclone does that when it is viewing a team drive and not when it isn't so if you share files from a team drive to a non-team drive then they won't appear if listing the non-team drive with `--drive-shared-with-me`

It looks like the API has changed slightly since we last updated the drive backend.

It looks like maybe we should be setting the includeAllDrives flag (also deprecated!) and maybe we should be setting this permanently.

The Drive API used to error if you set includeTeamDrives on non team drives and vice versa.

It looks like some work is needed on the API here which will probably fix this issue.

Can you give this a go?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.48.0-100-gaa9db160-fix-3348-teamdrive-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Hey @ncw, just tested this now, and it works! Thank you! Another issue I found is `rclone ls` doesn't show files from Shared with me, but `rclone lsf` does.

> Hey @ncw, just tested this now, and it works!

Great!  I'll merge the above now.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.49

> Another issue I found is rclone ls doesn't show files from Shared with me, but rclone lsf does.

Note that `rclone ls` doesn't show directories at all which is the main difference between `lsf` and `ls`.  I'd be suprise if there was a difference betwen the two since they use the same code underneath.  Can you post the output of the commands please?

Can you post the output

Ok I can't post the output because there's way too many files but basically, this is what happened:
`rclone ls` --> lists files/directories in My Drive only
`rclone lsf` --> lists files/directories in Shared with me only
I'm assuming that both commands should be showing files from Shared with me?

> Ok I can't post the output because there's way too many files but basically, this is what happened:
> `rclone ls` --> lists files/directories in My Drive only
> `rclone lsf` --> lists files/directories in Shared with me only
> I'm assuming that both commands should be showing files from Shared with me?

Can you post the command lines you used for each?
